channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump administration says it's freezing child care funds to Minnesota
item.description: President Trump's administration announced that it's freezing child care funds to Minnesota after a series of fraud schemes in recent years.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump's administration announced that it's freezing child care funds to Minnesota after a series of fraud schemes in recent years.

(Image credit: Steve Karnowski)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Judge considers whether to detain or release D.C. pipe bomb suspect
item.description: The suspect in the attempted pipe bombing of political headquarters in 2021 appeared in court today for a pre-trial detention hearing.
item.content:encoded: The suspect in the attempted pipe bombing of political headquarters in 2021 appeared in court today for a pre-trial detention hearing.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: 2025 was a year of chaos for groups that help poor people
item.description: 2025 will go down as a year of chaos for groups that help poor people. Some have been forced to scale back as the Trump administration targeted safety-net programs.
item.content:encoded: 2025 will go down as a year of chaos for groups that help poor people. Some have been forced to scale back as the Trump administration targeted safety-net programs.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: Federal appeals court judge is accused of bullying her clerks
item.description: The Legal Accountability Project complaint, which has not been previously reported, states that it is based on conversations with multiple former law clerks.
item.content:encoded:
The Legal Accountability Project complaint, which has not been previously reported, states that it is based on conversations with multiple former law clerks.

(Image credit: Mark Lennihan)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Thousands watch livestream of Maine family's food pantry for deer
item.description: A three-generation family in Maine set up a camera to capture their deer-feeding station. Thousands watch online as hundreds of white-tailed deer enjoy the food at Brownville's Food Pantry for Deer.
item.content:encoded: A three-generation family in Maine set up a camera to capture their deer-feeding station. Thousands watch online as hundreds of white-tailed deer enjoy the food at Brownville's Food Pantry for Deer.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: North Carolina residents affected by Hurricane Helene still waiting for aid from FEMA
item.description: People in North Carolina who lost their homes during Hurricane Helene are still waiting for FEMA to step in and help. State officials say the agency is stalling applications for relief.
item.content:encoded: People in North Carolina who lost their homes during Hurricane Helene are still waiting for FEMA to step in and help. State officials say the agency is stalling applications for relief.
item.dc:creator: Laura Hackett

item.title: Non-U.S. residents will soon have to pay $100 surcharge to enter 11 national parks
item.description: Starting Jan. 1, non-U.S. citizens will have to pay an additional $100 each to enter 11 of America's most popular National Parks.
item.content:encoded: Starting Jan. 1, non-U.S. citizens will have to pay an additional $100 each to enter 11 of America's most popular National Parks.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Cohen

item.title: Wildlife crossings save animals, people and billions in vehicular damage costs
item.description: Car crashes with wildlife kill about 200 Americans every year. Federal funding is helping states build safe animal crossings to reduce the carnage.
item.content:encoded: Car crashes with wildlife kill about 200 Americans every year. Federal funding is helping states build safe animal crossings to reduce the carnage.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Daniel

item.title: When ice and snow build up on the roads, this woman heads out for a drive
item.description: Driving a snowplow isn't for everyone. It means long hours driving a tank-like truck, and always in weather that would keep many folks at home. We take a ride with a young woman who loves her job.
item.content:encoded: Driving a snowplow isn't for everyone. It means long hours driving a tank-like truck, and always in weather that would keep many folks at home. We take a ride with a young woman who loves her job.
item.dc:creator: Emily Russell

item.title: The Navy is struggling to build ships
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Cynthia Cook from the Center for International and Strategic Studies about why naval shipbuilding in the U.S. has become so difficult lately.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Cynthia Cook from the Center for International and Strategic Studies about why naval shipbuilding in the U.S. has become so difficult lately.
item.dc:creator: Henry Larson
